result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin D. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:49 am 
INCLUDES 20CF507, 20CF684, 20CF734, 21CF384, 21CF547, 22CF143, 21TR1360, 21TR1361, 21TR1362, 21TR1363, & 21TR1364. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan.   
VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 20CF507: Cts. 1-3>>D&RI. 
In 20CF684: Cts. 1 & 2>>D&RI. 
In 20CF734: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 21CF384: Cts. 1 & 2>>D&RI. 
In 21CF547: Ct. 2>>D&RI. 
In 22CF143: Cts. 1-7>>D&RI. 
Uncharged DA Case 20MA3817>>D&RI. 
In 21TR1360: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 21TR1362: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 21TR1363: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
In 21TR1364: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 20CF684: Ct. 3 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 20CF734: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>NOCONTEST. 
In 21CF384: Ct. 3 (Operate Firearm While Intoxicated)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 21CF547: Ct. 1 (Vehicle Operator Flee-Elude Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 21TR1361: Ct. 1 (Exceeding Speed Zones, etc/45+ MPH)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 21TR1361: Ct. 1>>$515.50 inclusive; 6 pts against dl; 9 months dl suspension with admin credit. 
In 20CF684: Ct. 3>>SWH for 3 yrs probation - ADDITIONAL CONDITION>>$1000 restitution to CF plus 10% surcharge to be paid at the rate of at least $150 per month. 
In 20CF734: Ct. 2>>SWH for 2 yrs probation - ADDITIONAL CONDITION>>30 days MCJ imposed and STAYED.  
In 21CF384: Ct. 3>>SWH for 2 yrs probation. 
In 21CF547: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL>> sign up for and successfully complete SAFE program; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with CF, JW, TE, CC, & CC unless authorized by dept; DNA sample/surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 5 days jail credit in 21CF547 and NO credit in other files. 

Probation Review Hrg set for 11/18/2022 at 1:15 pm. 

COURT makes findings and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation - deft to file written expungement request. 
Adj: 11:15 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Calendar call on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:46 am 
INCLUDES 20CF507, 20CF684, 20CF734, 21CF384, 21CF547, 22CF143, 21TR1360, 21TR1361, 21TR1362, 21TR1363, & 21TR1364. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Date and time was set for plea/sentencing hrg. 
Atty Morgan requests plea/sentencing be reset to allow time to complete plea form. 
CC set for 8/17/2022 at 1:00 pm to reset plea/sentencing hrg. 
Adj: 10:49 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
No driving without valid dl. Prints and photograph.
